title: Endometriosis care needs urgent improvement, MPs say
description: The condition, which causes severe pain and heavy periods, takes eight years on average to be diagnosed.

title: 'The fake reporter wanted to know about our software'
description: As image recognition software is increasingly used, one firm had to deal with subterfuge.

title: PC Andrew Harper death: Why his family wants the law to change
description: PC Andrew Harper was dragged to his death by teenagers who were cleared of murder. Does the law need to change?

title: Instagram filters: 'You can't wear my skin for likes'
description: Instagram filters are treating ethnicity and skin colour 'like an accessory".

title: Far-right online: 'I got them back on social media'
description: 'I cannot bear the chance of something that I've done makes somebody else go and do something horrific.'

title: Sudan khalwas: Undercover in the schools that chain boys
description: A BBC News Arabic investigation has uncovered systemic child abuse inside Islamic schools in Sudan.

title: Anti-Trump TikTokkers not declaring paid content
description: TikTok creators have been making anti-Trump videos without disclosing they were paid for.

title: Tottenham 3-3 West Ham: How late collapse took shine off Harry Kane masterclass
description: The positives from the way Harry Kane inspired Tottenham to build up a 3-0 lead against West Ham were wasted as they threw victory away, says former Spurs star Danny Murphy.

title: US election 2020: What are Trump's and Biden's policies?
description: Some of President Trump's and Joe Biden's key policies explained and compared.

title: Nottingham's Banksy artwork: 'We needed something like this'
description: Banksy's work in Nottingham is bringing excitement and pride to residents across the city.

title: Cat's return after three years 'takes the Biscuit'
description: Keith Bigland's cat, Biscuit, vanished in 2017 after escaping from his home, in March, Cambs.

title: Covid-19: Row over rules 'not just about Greater Manchester'
description: The region's mayor calls on Boris Johnson to negotiate with him over stricter Covid-19 curbs.

title: Coronavirus: Dutch PM concedes 'wrong assessment' over royal holiday
description: Facing strong criticism, the royals cut short a trip to Greece they began during a partial lockdown.

title: 'Boxing has a new star' - Lopez overcomes Lomachenko in Las Vegas
description: Teofimo Lopez beats Vasyl Lomachenko on points in Las Vegas to claim all four world lightweight world titles after the much-anticipated fight.

title: Paralympics 2012 opening ceremony dancer Dave Toole dies
description: Dave Toole's routine high above the Olympic Stadium has been described as "mighty and beautiful".

title: Is sainthood on the cards for a computer programmer?
description: A computer programmer’s beatification could lead to the world’s first millennial saint.

title: Virgil van Dijk injury is not good, says Jurgen Klopp after Liverpool draw with Everton
description: Liverpool defender Virgil van Dijk's knee injury is "not good", says the champions' manager Jurgen Klopp.

title: Brexit: Door 'still ajar' for EU trade talks, says Gove
description: The UK will continue to engage but only if the EU changes its position in key areas, says Michael Gove.

title: Nagorno-Karabakh: Armenia-Azerbaijan truce broken minutes after deal
description: Each accuses the other of violating a humanitarian ceasefire agreed on Saturday.

title: What is the big picture for English football now after turbulent week?
description: BBC sports editor Dan Roan examines the fallout from an extraordinary week which started with Project Big Picture and ended with more questions.

title: Champions Cup: Does dynasty beckon for Exeter after historic European win?
description: After clinching their first Champions Cup, could the next 10 years eclipse even Exeter's previous decade?

title: The papers: MPs 'flouted 10pm curfew', and young jobs 'crisis'
description: Senior political figures are accused of breaching Covid restrictions in some of Sunday's papers.

title: London Bridge attack: Steven Gallant up for early release after confronting knifeman
description: Convicted murderer Steven Gallant was on day release when he helped stop a knifeman's rampage.

title: Coronavirus: Empty streets in France as curfew enforced
description: The overnight curfew in nine cities is aimed at curbing the soaring Covid infection rate in France.

title: Strictly Come Dancing launch sees Nicola Adams and Katya Jones paired
description: Former boxer Nicola Adams and Katya Jones will be the show's first celebrity same-sex couple.

title: US woman faces first federal execution since 1953
description: Lisa Montgomery is due to become the first woman to face federal execution in the US in 67 years.
